abstract: The British singer will make her first New York appearance in decades.
snippet: The British singer will make her first New York appearance in decades.
lead_paragraph: Petula Clark, the British singer and actress best known for her hit "Downtown," will make her first appearance at a New York City nightclub since the 1970s early next year, her publicist said. Ms. Clark, who is 78, lives in Switzerland and has not played New York for decades. She will appear at Feinstein's at Loews Regency on Park Avenue at 61st Street from Jan. 24 to Feb. 4, performing her hits, including "I Know a Place" and "My Love," as well as songs from musicals she appeared in, both onstage and screen.
